page.title: 04Religion-Woolaston Church
page.content: Dedicated to St.Andrew. Built by the Normans in the 13th century on an earlier holy site. Tower rebuilt in 1859 (see photo) Inside-main altar and a smaller Lady Chapel used for small congregations.The pulpit came from Clayton, Northants-dates from the 1750s. The font is 14th century. It is unusual because it is one mile away from the modern village-because original village around the church was abandoned due to the plague in the 17th century.The pauper's cross in the graveyard has holes in it where money was offered in vinegar to prevent plague transmission. There is a rumour in the village due to cost of upkeep church will close soon and congregation transferred to Alvington. The Rectory has been sold.
